entities.name: muggles
entities.description: The text mentions 'two Muggles' and 'six or seven Muggles', indicating that Muggles is a group of people. They are described as ordinary non-magical individuals who witnessed something unusual.

entities.name: london
entities.description: The text mentions 'London' as the location where two Muggles saw an old car flying over the Post Office tower. London is a city in England, UK.

entities.name: post office tower
entities.description: The text mentions 'the Post Office tower' as a location in London where two Muggles saw an old car flying. The Post Office Tower is a famous landmark in London.

entities.name: norfolk
entities.description: The text mentions 'Norfolk' as the location where Mrs Hetty Bayliss saw something unusual at noon. Norfolk is a county in England, UK.

entities.name: hetty bayliss
entities.description: The text mentions 'Mrs Hetty Bayliss' as one of the Muggles who saw something unusual. She is described as a person hanging out her washing at noon in Norfolk.

entities.name: angus fleet
entities.description: The text mentions 'Mr Angus Fleet' as one of the Muggles who reported to police. He is described as a person from Peebles.

entities.name: peebles
entities.description: The text mentions 'Peebles' as the location where Mr Angus Fleet is from. Peebles is a town in Scotland, UK.

relationships.description: The text mentions that two Muggles saw an old car flying over the Post Office tower in London. This indicates a relationship between the Muggles and the location of London.
